title: Does technology help us to reach self-realization and make us see ourselves as a total human being and be more understandable? - Quora

response.answer_text: Blessings, … although God~Spirit can employ anything to aid the earnest seeker in the discovering of truth, be assured … you, and every other sentient on the planet were born wanting for nothing … all that is ever needed is resident within you … sentients do not need, and indeed, are most often dramatically injured or led astray by the surrender of their minds and will to presuppositional, artificially ‘programmed’ (alleged) “truth” … for the truth … absolute and unassailable … is ever present within you … residing there, in the secret chambers of your heart … that sacred place alone … is where the journey that concludes all journeys, both begins and ends … the rest of life’s rambling succession of entertainment (entrainment) including artificial/inorganic intelligence is cake and circus, subterfuge and illusion. … trust in organic, pristine, ageless truth to set you free … to liberate you from all enslavement … become quiet and still … for your heart awaits your presence … seek only the truth that is written within every “cell” (i.e., every electro-magnetic orbit of charged energy smiling within your being) … align with truth, and as promised … the truth shall set you free. Namaste’ MLji

technology is what you make of it. my phone is used to do calks, cruise for hot guys , google things, snag n send a pic here and there and as extension of my computing facilities. its a tool with a little toy in it. all but a few of my friends game. a couple of them game 24/7 so no time to complain. the rest stop long enough to whine about the inhumanity.of it all. technology helps you to do what you want to do. it does not make you forget everything else. you are choosing to mismanage your time if that happens to you. thats fine; its your time to waste. but then dont bitch to me that it is isolating you.
